media.title: 10,000 BC (2008)
media.ratingDescription: sequences of intense action and violence.
media.description: A prehistoric epic that follows a young mammoth hunter's journey through uncharted territory to secure the future of his tribe.

media.title: 10 Things I Hate About You (1999)
media.ratingDescription: crude sex-related humor and dialogue, alcohol and drug-related scenes, all involving teens.
media.description: A remake of the classic Shakespare play The Taming of the Shrew., set in a modern day highschool.

media.title: 17 Again (2009)
media.ratingDescription: language, some sexual material and teen partying.
media.description: About a guy whose life didn't quite turn out how he wanted it to and wishes he could go back to high school and change it. He wakes up one day and is seventeen again and gets the chance to rewrite his life.

media.title: Across the Universe (2007)
media.ratingDescription: some drug content, nudity, sexuality, violence and language.
media.description: The music of the Beatles and the Vietnam War form the backdrop for the romance between an upper-class American girl and a poor Liverpudlian artist.

media.title: Chicago (2002)
media.ratingDescription: sexual content and dialogue, violence and thematic elements.
media.description: Murderesses Velma Kelly (a chanteuse and tease who killed her husband and sister after finding them in bed together) and Roxie Hart (who killed her boyfriend when she discovered he wasn't going to make her a star) find themselves on death row together and fight for the fame that will keep them from the gallows in 1920s Chicago.

media.title: Grease (1978)
media.description: Good girl Sandy and greaser Danny fell in love over the summer. But when they unexpectedly discover they're now in the same high school, will they be able to rekindle their romance?

media.title: Grease 2 (1982)
media.description: An English student at a 1960's American high school has to prove himself to the leader of a girls' gang whose members can only date greasers.

media.title: Grease 2 (1982)
media.description: An English student at a 1960's American high school has to prove himself to the leader of a girls' gang whose members can only date greasers.

media.title: Hairspray (2007)
media.ratingDescription: language, some suggestive content and momentary teen smoking.
media.description: Pleasantly plump teenager Tracy Turnblad teaches 1962 Baltimore a thing or two about integration after landing a spot on a local TV dance show.

media.title: Help! (1965)
media.description: Ringo finds himself the human sacrifice target of a cult and the band must try to protect him from it.

media.title: Moulin Rouge! (2001)
media.ratingDescription: sexual content.
media.description: A poet falls for a beautiful courtesan whom a jealous duke covets in this stylish musical, with music drawn from familiar 20th century sources.

media.title: Batman (1989)
media.description: The Dark Knight of Gotham City begins his war on crime with his first major enemy being the clownishly homicidal Joker.

media.title: Batman Forever (1995)
media.ratingDescription: strong stylized action.
media.description: Batman must battle Two-Face and The Riddler with help of an amourous psychologist and a young circus acrobat who becomes his sidekick, Robin.

media.title: Batman Begins (2005)
media.ratingDescription: intense action violence, disturbing images and some thematic elements.
media.description: The story of how Bruce Wayne became what he was destined to be: Batman.

media.title: Daredevil (2003)
media.ratingDescription: action/violence and some sensuality.
media.description: A man blinded by toxic waste which also enhanced his remaining senses fights crime as an acrobatic martial arts superhero.

media.title: Elektra (2005)
media.ratingDescription: action violence.
media.description: Elektra the warrior survives a near-death experience, becomes an assassin-for-hire, and tries to protect her two latest targets, a single father and his young daughter, from a group of supernatural assassins.

media.title: Fantastic Four (2005)
media.ratingDescription: sequences of intense action, and some suggestive content.
media.description: A group of astronauts gain superpowers after a cosmic radiation exposure and must use them to oppose the plans of their enemy, Doctor Victor Von Doom

media.title: Fantastic 4: Rise of the Silver Surfer (2007)
media.previousTitle: Fantastic4 Rise Of The Silver Surfer
media.rating: sequences of action violence, some mild language and innuendo.
media.ratingDescription: sequences of action violence, some mild language and innuendo.
media.description: The Fantastic Four learn that they aren't the only super-powered beings in the universe when they square off against the powerful Silver Surfer and the planet-eating Galactus.
media.grammar: Fantastic4 Rise Of The Silver Surfer

media.title: Hulk (2003)
media.ratingDescription: sci-fi action violence, some disturbing images and brief partial nudity.
media.description: Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry.

media.title: Iron Man (2008)
media.ratingDescription: some intense sequences of sci-fi action and violence, and brief suggestive content.
media.description: When wealthy industrialist Tony Stark is forced to build an armored suit after a life-threatening incident, he ultimately decides to use its technology to fight against evil.

media.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen (2003)
media.ratingDescription: intense sequences of fantasy violence, language and innuendo.
media.description: In an alternate Victorian Age world, a group of famous contemporary fantasy, SF and adventure characters team up on a secret mission.

media.title: Spawn (1997)
media.ratingDescription: thematic elements involving the demonic underworld, violence, intense fantasy action and crude humor. (edited version); originally Rated R for violence and crude humor.
media.description: A mercenary is killed, but comes back from Hell as a reluctant soldier of the Devil.

media.title: Spider-Man (2002)
media.ratingDescription: stylized violence and action.
media.description: When bitten by a genetically modified spider, a nerdy, shy, and awkward high school student gains spider-like abilities that he eventually must use to fight evil as a superhero after tragedy befalls his family.

media.title: Spider-Man 2 (2004)
media.description: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius, who becomes Doctor Octopus (aka Doc Ock), after an accident causes him to bond psychically with mechanical tentacles that do his bidding.

media.title: Spider-Man 3 (2007)
media.ratingDescription: sequences of intense action violence.
media.description: A strange black entity from another world bonds with Peter Parker and causes inner turmoil as he contends with new villains, temptations, and revenge.

media.title: Superman (1978)
media.ratingDescription: peril, some mild sensuality and language.
media.description: An alien orphan is sent from his dying planet to Earth, where he grows up to become his adoptive home's first and greatest super-hero.

media.title: Superman Returns (2006)
media.ratingDescription: some intense action violence.
media.description: After a long visit to the lost remains of the planet Krypton, the Man of Steel returns to earth to become the peoples savior once again and reclaim the love of Lois Lane.

media.title: Hulk (2003)
media.ratingDescription: sci-fi action violence, some disturbing images and brief partial nudity.
media.description: Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry.

media.title: The Dark Knight (2008)
media.ratingDescription: intense sequences of violence and some menace.
media.description: Batman, Gordon and Harvey Dent are forced to deal with the chaos unleashed by an anarchist mastermind known only as the Joker, as it drives each of them to their limits.

media.title: X-Men (2000)
media.ratingDescription: sci-fi action violence.
media.description: Two mutants come to a private academy for mutants whose resident superhero team must oppose a powerful mutant terrorist organization.

media.title: X2 (2003)
media.ratingDescription: sci-fi action/violence, some sexuality and brief language.
media.description: The X-Men band together to find a mutant assassin who has made an attempt on the President's life, while the Mutant Academy is attacked by military forces.

media.title: X-Men: The Last Stand (2006)
media.ratingDescription: intense sequences of action violence, some sexual content and language.
media.description: When a cure is found to treat mutations, lines are drawn amongst the X-Men, led by Professor Charles Xavier, and the Brotherhood, a band of powerful mutants organized under Xavier's former ally, Magneto.
